review.title: Towards The Development of a Bishnupriya Manipuri Corpus
review.abstract: For any deep computational processing of language we need evidences, and one such set of evidences is corpus. This paper describes the development of a text-based corpus for the Bishnupriya Manipuri language. A Corpus is considered as a building block for any language processing tasks. Due to the lack of awareness like other Indian languages, it is also studied less frequently. As a result the language still lacks a good corpus and basic language processing tools. As per our knowledge this is the first effort to develop a corpus for Bishnupriya Manipuri language.
histories: 5 pages, conference at National Conference on Recent Trends in Computer Sciences at Bodoland University, 25th-26th March, 2013
review.COMMENTS: 5 pages, conference at National Conference on Recent Trends in Computer Sciences at Bodoland University, 25th-26th March, 2013

metadata.title: Towards The Development of a Bishnupriya Manipuri Corpus

sections.text: This work describes the development of a text-based corpus for the Bishnuya Manipuri language. As a result, the language still lacks a good corpus and basic language processing tools. To our knowledge, this is the first effort to develop a corpus for Bishnupriya language. Keywords corpus, language, bishnupriya, language, word analysis, word frequency language are the first approaches to the exploration of natural language processing applications. A corpus data can contain text in a single language (monolingual corpus) or in multiple languages (multilingual corpus).

sections.heading: Feature Analysis:
sections.text: When developing a corpus, we should consider some characteristics. First, we should take into account the mood of the text data, whether the data collected is in speech or writing; second, the data samples collected for the corpus should be considered for the corpus, but the samples should be in the right size for the system to process the data; third, data samples collected for the corpus should be good enough to represent the language; and last, the corpus should be balanced, covering different types of text with all the characteristics; it has already been recognized that free resources on the Internet, such as blogs, Wikipedia, web pages, etc. could be used to develop a large corpus. Such material could create a problem if we collect it from different sources; free resources on the Internet, such as blogs, web pages, Wikipedia, etc. become the source for developing a corpus.

sections.heading: Gender Suffixes:
sections.text: A. In the case of words that denote people, are used before the word male and female genders. For example, the female gender is generally characterized by the use of the word "female" after the words "male" (munimanu: man) and "female" (elamanu: woman). C. sections.heading: Number suffixes:
sections.text: A. The word that is mixed with the preceding stem, which is invariably a noun of the relationship, has a plural meaning. For example: This suffix is added to the singular forms in -bay (g) and -bay (han), leading to -bay (gi) and -bay (hani), respectively, in the sense of "a small number of." For example: This suffix is added to the singular forms in -bay (g) and in the form of -bay (han), resulting in "a large number of cases."
